title: Magnetic field - field lines around bar magnet

content.question: Which figure shows a correct representation for the magnetic field, and why?

choices.label: Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because magnetic field lines form closed loops that point away from the north pole and towards the south pole outside the magnet
Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because magnetic field lines originate on the north pole of the magnet and terminate on the south pole of the magnet
Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because the magnetic field lines from a bar magnet are straight lines
Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because the magnetic field lines at the ends of the magnets are parallel to each other

content.answer: Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because magnetic field lines form closed loops that point away from the north pole and towards the south pole outside the magnet
